title: Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site: Pets
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Pets              Pets          American's love their pets. They are a part of the family. With this in mind the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site does allow pets on site. However, there are a few rules to follow.  - Pets are welcome but must be maintained on a leash.  - Pets are allowed throughout the Historic Core and Overlook areas but not allowed inside buildings, unless they are service animals.   - You are expected to clean up after your pet. Remember to bring the "pooper scooper." - Do not allow your pet to chase or annoy any of the natural wildlife that it may encounter while visiting the site. Keep in mind that the natural wildlife is indeed wild and an encounter can lead to serious injury of your pet.   - You are responsible for any potential harm your pet may cause to others on site, whether park employee or visitor.   If you keep these things in mind you and your pet will have a safe and enjoyable visit to the historic site. Happy visiting!
